13#include <stddef.h>

17#include <numeric>

19#include "api/array_view.h"
20#include "common_audio/include/audio_util.h"

25namespace webrtc {
26namespace {
27constexpr int kFramesPerSecond = 100;
28
29float FrameEnergy(const AudioFrameView<const float>& audio) {
30 float energy = 0.0f;
31 for (size_t k = 0; k < audio.num_channels(); ++k) {
32 float channel_energy =
33 std::accumulate(audio.channel(k).begin(), audio.channel(k).end(), 0.0f,
34 [](float a, float b) -> float { return a + b * b; });
35 energy = std::max(channel_energy, energy);
36 }
37 return energy;
38}
39
40float EnergyToDbfs(float signal_energy, size_t num_samples) {
41 const float rms = std::sqrt(signal_energy / num_samples);
42 return FloatS16ToDbfs(rms);
43}
44
45class NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl : public NoiseLevelEstimator {
46 public:
47 NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl(ApmDataDumper* data_dumper)
48 : data_dumper_(data_dumper), signal_classifier_(data_dumper) {
49 // Initially assume that 48 kHz will be used. `Analyze()` will detect the
50 // used sample rate and call `Initialize()` again if needed.
51 Initialize(/*sample_rate_hz=*/48000);
52 }
53 NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl(const NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl&) = delete;
54 NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl& operator=(const NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl&) = delete;
55 ~NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl() = default;
56
57 float Analyze(const AudioFrameView<const float>& frame) override {
58 data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_noise_level_estimator_hold_counter",
59 noise_energy_hold_counter_);
60 const int sample_rate_hz =
61 static_cast<int>(frame.samples_per_channel() * kFramesPerSecond);
62 if (sample_rate_hz != sample_rate_hz_) {
63 Initialize(sample_rate_hz);
64 }
65 const float frame_energy = FrameEnergy(frame);
66 if (frame_energy <= 0.f) {
67 RTC_DCHECK_GE(frame_energy, 0.f);
68 data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_noise_level_estimator_signal_type", -1);
69 return EnergyToDbfs(noise_energy_, frame.samples_per_channel());
70 }
71
72 if (first_update_) {
73 // Initialize the noise energy to the frame energy.
74 first_update_ = false;
75 data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_noise_level_estimator_signal_type", -1);
76 noise_energy_ = std::max(frame_energy, min_noise_energy_);
77 return EnergyToDbfs(noise_energy_, frame.samples_per_channel());
78 }
79
80 const SignalClassifier::SignalType signal_type =
81 signal_classifier_.Analyze(frame.channel(0));
82 data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_noise_level_estimator_signal_type",
83 static_cast<int>(signal_type));
84
85 // Update the noise estimate in a minimum statistics-type manner.
86 if (signal_type == SignalClassifier::SignalType::kStationary) {
87 if (frame_energy > noise_energy_) {
88 // Leak the estimate upwards towards the frame energy if no recent
89 // downward update.
90 noise_energy_hold_counter_ =
91 std::max(noise_energy_hold_counter_ - 1, 0);
92
93 if (noise_energy_hold_counter_ == 0) {
94 constexpr float kMaxNoiseEnergyFactor = 1.01f;
95 noise_energy_ =
96 std::min(noise_energy_ * kMaxNoiseEnergyFactor, frame_energy);
97 }
98 } else {
99 // Update smoothly downwards with a limited maximum update magnitude.
100 constexpr float kMinNoiseEnergyFactor = 0.9f;
101 constexpr float kNoiseEnergyDeltaFactor = 0.05f;
102 noise_energy_ =
103 std::max(noise_energy_ * kMinNoiseEnergyFactor,
104 noise_energy_ - kNoiseEnergyDeltaFactor *
105 (noise_energy_ - frame_energy));
106 // Prevent an energy increase for the next 10 seconds.
107 constexpr int kNumFramesToEnergyIncreaseAllowed = 1000;
108 noise_energy_hold_counter_ = kNumFramesToEnergyIncreaseAllowed;
109 }
110 } else {
111 // TODO(bugs.webrtc.org/7494): Remove to not forget the estimated level.
112 // For a non-stationary signal, leak the estimate downwards in order to
113 // avoid estimate locking due to incorrect signal classification.
114 noise_energy_ = noise_energy_ * 0.99f;
115 }
116
117 // Ensure a minimum of the estimate.
118 noise_energy_ = std::max(noise_energy_, min_noise_energy_);
119 return EnergyToDbfs(noise_energy_, frame.samples_per_channel());
120 }
121
122 private:
123 void Initialize(int sample_rate_hz) {
124 sample_rate_hz_ = sample_rate_hz;
125 noise_energy_ = 1.0f;
126 first_update_ = true;
127 // Initialize the minimum noise energy to -84 dBFS.
128 min_noise_energy_ = sample_rate_hz * 2.0f * 2.0f / kFramesPerSecond;
129 noise_energy_hold_counter_ = 0;
130 signal_classifier_.Initialize(sample_rate_hz);
131 }
132
133 ApmDataDumper* const data_dumper_;
134 int sample_rate_hz_;
135 float min_noise_energy_;
136 bool first_update_;
137 float noise_energy_;
138 int noise_energy_hold_counter_;
139 SignalClassifier signal_classifier_;
140};
141
142// Updates the noise floor with instant decay and slow attack. This tuning is
143// specific for AGC2, so that (i) it can promptly increase the gain if the noise
144// floor drops (instant decay) and (ii) in case of music or fast speech, due to
145// which the noise floor can be overestimated, the gain reduction is slowed
146// down.
147float SmoothNoiseFloorEstimate(float current_estimate, float new_estimate) {
148 constexpr float kAttack = 0.5f;
149 if (current_estimate < new_estimate) {
150 // Attack phase.
151 return kAttack * new_estimate + (1.0f - kAttack) * current_estimate;
152 }
153 // Instant attack.
154 return new_estimate;
155}
156
157class NoiseFloorEstimator : public NoiseLevelEstimator {
158 public:
159 // Update the noise floor every 5 seconds.
160 static constexpr int kUpdatePeriodNumFrames = 500;
161 static_assert(kUpdatePeriodNumFrames >= 200,
162 "A too small value may cause noise level overestimation.");
163 static_assert(kUpdatePeriodNumFrames <= 1500,
164 "A too large value may make AGC2 slow at reacting to increased "
165 "noise levels.");
166
167 NoiseFloorEstimator(ApmDataDumper* data_dumper) : data_dumper_(data_dumper) {
168 // Initially assume that 48 kHz will be used. `Analyze()` will detect the
169 // used sample rate and call `Initialize()` again if needed.
170 Initialize(/*sample_rate_hz=*/48000);
171 }
172 NoiseFloorEstimator(const NoiseFloorEstimator&) = delete;
173 NoiseFloorEstimator& operator=(const NoiseFloorEstimator&) = delete;
174 ~NoiseFloorEstimator() = default;
175
176 float Analyze(const AudioFrameView<const float>& frame) override {
177 // Detect sample rate changes.
178 const int sample_rate_hz =
179 static_cast<int>(frame.samples_per_channel() * kFramesPerSecond);
180 if (sample_rate_hz != sample_rate_hz_) {
181 Initialize(sample_rate_hz);
182 }
183
184 const float frame_energy = FrameEnergy(frame);
185 if (frame_energy <= min_noise_energy_) {
186 // Ignore frames when muted or below the minimum measurable energy.
187 data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_noise_floor_estimator_preliminary_level",
188 noise_energy_);
189 return EnergyToDbfs(noise_energy_, frame.samples_per_channel());
190 }
191
192 if (preliminary_noise_energy_set_) {
193 preliminary_noise_energy_ =
194 std::min(preliminary_noise_energy_, frame_energy);
195 } else {
196 preliminary_noise_energy_ = frame_energy;
197 preliminary_noise_energy_set_ = true;
198 }
199 data_dumper_->DumpRaw("agc2_noise_floor_estimator_preliminary_level",
200 preliminary_noise_energy_);
201
202 if (counter_ == 0) {
203 // Full period observed.
204 first_period_ = false;
205 // Update the estimated noise floor energy with the preliminary
206 // estimation.
207 noise_energy_ = SmoothNoiseFloorEstimate(
208 /*current_estimate=*/noise_energy_,
209 /*new_estimate=*/preliminary_noise_energy_);
210 // Reset for a new observation period.
211 counter_ = kUpdatePeriodNumFrames;
212 preliminary_noise_energy_set_ = false;
213 } else if (first_period_) {
214 // While analyzing the signal during the initial period, continuously
215 // update the estimated noise energy, which is monotonic.
216 noise_energy_ = preliminary_noise_energy_;
217 counter_--;
218 } else {
219 // During the observation period it's only allowed to lower the energy.
220 noise_energy_ = std::min(noise_energy_, preliminary_noise_energy_);
221 counter_--;
222 }
223 return EnergyToDbfs(noise_energy_, frame.samples_per_channel());
224 }
225
226 private:
227 void Initialize(int sample_rate_hz) {
228 sample_rate_hz_ = sample_rate_hz;
229 first_period_ = true;
230 preliminary_noise_energy_set_ = false;
231 // Initialize the minimum noise energy to -84 dBFS.
232 min_noise_energy_ = sample_rate_hz * 2.0f * 2.0f / kFramesPerSecond;
233 preliminary_noise_energy_ = min_noise_energy_;
234 noise_energy_ = min_noise_energy_;
235 counter_ = kUpdatePeriodNumFrames;
236 }
237
238 ApmDataDumper* const data_dumper_;
239 int sample_rate_hz_;
240 float min_noise_energy_;
241 bool first_period_;
242 bool preliminary_noise_energy_set_;
243 float preliminary_noise_energy_;
244 float noise_energy_;
245 int counter_;
246};
247
248} // namespace
249
250std::unique_ptr<NoiseLevelEstimator> CreateStationaryNoiseEstimator(
251 ApmDataDumper* data_dumper) {
252 return std::make_unique<NoiseLevelEstimatorImpl>(data_dumper);
253}
254
255std::unique_ptr<NoiseLevelEstimator> CreateNoiseFloorEstimator(
256 ApmDataDumper* data_dumper) {
257 return std::make_unique<NoiseFloorEstimator>(data_dumper);
258}
259
